intro: Tovaria racemosa, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Tovaria racemosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
